headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

issueOrPullRequest.body:
Resolved: https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/issues/2285

This PR adds example implementations for the agent skills pattern.

I think agent skills are more of a design pattern than a built-in feature. Only the `skills/` directory structure and the `SKILL.md` format are standardized. The developer prompt and how skill content is loaded are fully customizable.

The main idea is progressive disclosure. The base prompt stays small. Skills are listed first, and full skill content is loaded only when the agent needs it.

## Example details:

- `examples/agent_patterns/agent_skills.py` shows a minimal approach. It discovers available skills, renders a skills section in the developer prompt, and uses a `load_skill` tool to read a specific `SKILL.md` file.
- `examples/agent_patterns/agent_skills_shell.py` shows a shell-based approach. It uses `ShellTool` to read skill files and run skill scripts written in bash when needed.
issueOrPullRequest.title: Add agent skills pattern examples
